Sentencas: In recent years, the interest for using biogas derived from biomass as fuel in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) has increased.
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel

Sentencas: To maximise the biogas to electrical energy output, it is important to study the effects of the main biogas components (CH4 and CO2), minor ones and traces (e. g. H2S) on performance and durability of the SOFC.
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel

Sentencas: Single anode-supported SOFCs with Ni-Yttria-Stabilised-Zirconia (YSZ) anodes, YSZ electrolytes and lanthanum-strontium-manganite (LSM)-YSZ cathodes have been tested with a CH4-H2O-H-2 fuel mixture at open circuit voltage (OCV) and 1 A cm(-2) current load (850 degrees C).
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel

Sentencas: The cell performance was monitored with electric measurements and impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel

Sentencas: At OCV 2-24 ppm H2S were added to the fuel in 24 h intervals.
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel

Sentencas: The reforming activity of the Ni-containing anode decreased rapidly when H2S was added to the fuel.
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel

Sentencas: This ultimately resulted in a lower production of fuel (H-2 and CO) from CH4.
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel

Sentencas: Applying 1 A cm(-2) current load, a maximum concentration of 7 ppm H2S was acceptable for a 24 h period.
Titulo: The Effect of H2S on the Performance of SOFCs using Methane Containing Fuel
